tournament.name: Tuesday 7th Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful control cards and ramp spells to establish control over the game while generating card advantage. The key strategy involves controlling the board with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and countering key spells with cards like Aether Gust and Neutralize. The deck also aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to play powerful threats like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon. The deck also has strong card draw and recursion through cards like Omen of the Sea, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. Additionally, by utilizing the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck can further generate value by blinking permanents like Omen of the Sea and Elspeth Conquers Death.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards such as Teferi, Time Raveler, Shatter the Sky, and Aether Gust to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By ramping up with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and maintain card advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as the companion allows for more consistency and synergy within the deck, while cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Agent of Treachery provide powerful threats and win conditions.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and outvalue them with card advantage from cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Narset, Parter of Veils. By consistently drawing cards and generating value, the deck seeks to control the board and eventually win through powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through flickering permanents for extra ETB triggers.

The primary focus of this deck is to create an aggressive playing style using a mono black strategy. The key concept revolves around efficiently controlling the board and exploiting sacrificial effects. The deck incorporates cards like Witch's Oven and Priest of Forgotten Gods to generate value through sacrificing creatures. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Fiend Artisan and Ayara, First of Locthwain to maintain card advantage and deal damage. The win condition is achieved through the synergy of Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Cauldron Familiar, providing a consistent and impactful source of damage.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with powerful spells and creatures while taking advantage of the Fires of Invention enchantment. By casting spells for free and using powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and gain control of the game. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Sphinx of Foresight and Cavalier of Flame provide additional win conditions, while cards like Elspeth Conquers Death provide removal options. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to quickly play powerful cards without paying their mana cost. It controls the board through sweepers like Deafening Clarion while generating card advantage with Teferi, Time Raveler. The key win condition is using Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Sphinx of Foresight for card selection and value. Ultimately, the goal is to control the game until the big threats can take over and close out the game.

The main idea of this deck is to use Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, allowing you to control the board with powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Cavalier of Flame. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Mortify to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the deck features Sphinx of Foresight and Keruga, the Macrosage as card advantage engines to ensure you maintain control of the game. The overall strategy revolves around resource management and efficient spell casting to outvalue your opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Elspeth Conquers Death. The key idea is to generate value and maintain control of the game through a combination of permission spells, removal, and powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Cavalier of Flame. Keruga, the Macrosage provides additional card draw and the companion mechanic adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a grindy, controlling matchup.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn, while controlling the board with removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way to provide card advantage and control the game. The win conditions are Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King, which can both close out the game quickly. The deck aims to control the game and pressure the opponent with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap cycling cards to quickly cycle through the deck and build up a board of creatures. With cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, players can deal damage to the opponent while cycling through their deck to find key pieces like Zenith Flare for a big finish. Improbable Alliance provides additional tokens for more aggression, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows players to consistently bring back low-cost creatures from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature damage and powerful cycling spells.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies backed by removal spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence with efficient creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Rotting Regisaur, supported by cards like Whisper Squad and Gutterbones for constant pressure. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion amplifies the deck's damage output, making it challenging for opponents to keep up with the aggressive onslaught. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Drill Bit to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with low-cost, evasive creatures like Brineborn Cutthroat and Sea-Dasher Octopus. These creatures can be protected with counterspells like Quench and Sinister Sabotage, while also using tempo cards like Unsummon to disrupt your opponent's game plan. With a solid mana base of Islands and card selection from Opt, this deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats and disruption to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to flood the board with aggressive creatures that can benefit from the card advantage provided by the companion Umori, the Collector. By utilizing powerful mutate creatures like Auspicious Starrix and Illuna, Apex of Wishes, as well as additional support from Gemrazer and End-Raze Forerunners, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and efficient offense. The mana base is designed to support the necessary colors for casting spells and activating abilities while maintaining a high creature count to maximize Umori's potential.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw, while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. The deck aims to control the opponent's threats and eventually win through a large Expansion / Explosion or Shark Typhoon. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card advantage and life gain, while Brazen Borrower can deal with problematic permanents. The deck's mana base is optimized to consistently cast its spells and activate Castle Vantress for additional control.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through counterspells, removal, card draw, and token generation. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Shark Typhoon. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra ETB triggers. With a strong mana base and a mix of reactive and proactive spells, the deck seeks to outlast and outvalue opponents in a grindy game.
